item.description:
InfiniTango

InfiniTango's performances combine the essence of Tango Argentino, Nuevo Tango, International Tango - the pulse, the sorrow and its emotional intensity together with the musicians’ personal expressions. Formed a few years ago in Connecticut and comprised of a violinist – Jessica Meyer, an accordionist – Markus Centola, a pianist – Maria Centola, and a double bass player – Sean Rubin, this dynamic ensemble of young professionals has created a bright and unique repertoire equally suited for the dance hall or the concert stage. While evoking an unforgettable Argentine sentiment with classics from “Golden Age”, they also create new, innovative works with a timeless sense of beauty. Infinitango plays the music with a deep understanding of tradition as well as an obsessive desire to evolve the art form to new levels. Joined at the Festival by dancers, this dynamic ensemble will bring tango to life.
http://www.artidea.or...

Another Arts & Ideas venue, lets get down there at 5:30 and Picnic, before the show starts, we can walk over to the Temple Plaza and see world reknowned Artist Felice Varini, installation piece "Square With Four Circles" created in that alley way.
http://www.siteprojec...

Then enjoy this free concert on the Green at 6:30.
item.how_to_find_us: I will fly the BW Piano Key Scarf on a tall stake, check out attending pictures to connect.
item.name: InfiniTango
